title: [K-12] Advanced Medical and Nursing Education Course Using Technology-Enhanced Simulation: Integrating Social Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology, understanding patient care protocols, familiarity with fundamental nursing skills (symptom observation, safety measures), and foundational awareness of healthcare systems and patient rights
context.additional_context: VR/simulation-based acquisition and assessment of medical/nursing skills in large-scale practical training environments. Scenarios incorporate social contexts (healthcare systems, patient rights, treatment protocols, cultural diversity, social responsibility). Integrates educational goals for community health promotion and civic consciousness development.

learning_goals: Perform basic vital sign measurement and documentation with over 90% accuracy in a simulation environment (compliant with medical protocols and patient rights).
Achieve over 85% compliance with patient safety protocols, emergency response procedures, and medical ethics standards in VR-based scenarios.
Demonstrate medical team collaboration skills at level 4 or higher (5-point scale) through team-based simulation evaluations (emphasizing civic roles and accountability).
Score 80 points or higher (out of 100) on a knowledge assessment after technology-enhanced simulation training (covering medical ethics, legal standards, and social responsibility).

By the end of the 6-month course, learners complete three types of projects reflecting real medical scenarios (e.g., emergency room, operating room, clinic) and propose solutions meeting at least six of eight problem-solving checklist items per task (e.g., patient diagnosis, treatment planning, symptom management, cultural sensitivity).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
